website_summaries.verdict: A perfect choice for paper towel lovers who want to be more green.
cons: Towels are considered a paper towel substitute

customer_reviews.title: Very Strong and Save on Paper Towels!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on July 21, 2017. I thought you would like to see how they held up since then. I have only used one so far so I could "put it to the test." This is what it looks like today. I use it every day and several times a day and I have put it in the washing machine three times. It's in great shape! I have saved a lot of money on paper towels. I don't use it for washing dishes. (I use Starfiber Scrubbies) I use Skoy cloth for counter tops, table, sink, appliances, stove, etc. The photos show it just taken out of the washing machine for the third time.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Durable, reusable, gets the gunk off pans without harming nonstick surfaces
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Says you can wash in clothes washer, dishwasher or microwave. We washed in clothes washer and it came ou like new. They do a great job of scrubbing off hard to clean gunk on dishes and pans without harming nonstick coatings or fragile surfaces. They’re amazing. I got rid of all my sponges and ordered a bunch of these after getting a set as a gift. But so far haven’t had to open the new ones because thy haven’t warn at all even with daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Jck

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT replace paper towels, but is absorbent . . .
customer_reviews.text: Paper towels cannot really be replaced in my kitchen just because this product absorbs a lot of liquid. Paper towels are something I use when I want to get rid of grease in pots and pans so that it will not go down my sink drain and clog it. You can't use this produce to wipe up dog pee or poop like paper towels because then you can dispose totally of the paper towels. So only get this product if you have lots of beverage spills or water spills in your household. Can be cut in half and used as a dis cloth, I suppose, but I'd rather have a sponge as a dishcloth.
customer_reviews.author: gpdooby

customer_reviews.title: Biggest lie on amazon
customer_reviews.text: this thing is uselesas , its a flaT SPONGE, GO AHEAD USE IT AND SPEND 3 MINUTES RINSING IT OUT, i have a sponge, i have paper towels, you do need this
customer_reviews.author: Rice n Beans

customer_reviews.title: Best eco-friendly cleaning cloths I've used!
customer_reviews.text: Skoy is the second brand of eco-friendly cleaning cloths I've used. Had I tried this brand first, I would have known to rate the competitor brand less than the 5-stars I gave them because Skoy truly deserves the 5-stars for this product. These cloths have much a softer texture than the competitor brand, which I prefer. I've been using one cloth in the kitchen for almost one month now with no real signs of wear yet and still odorless! The competitor brand started to fall apart after three weeks of daily use, revealing a mesh material sandwiched in the center. I microwave the cloths as directed once a day. Excellent product -- would recommend for every kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: skoy color was left on counter top
customer_reviews.text: I really thought these skoys would be great in every way- claims 1=15 rolls of paper towels. Great for environment & wallet. I would have gladly given 5 stars; however, my daughter wiped over my kitchen counter tops with a paper towel without realizing I started using skoys. The color left a light residue on my counters. I am disappointed because I did not see anyone else state the same experience. The counter looked and felt clean, but if it requires using paper towels after each use it completely defeats the purpose of buying these. I was ready to buy several more, but after seeing what color residue came off- looks like I will need to continue using paper towels:(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Surprisingly soft and malleable
customer_reviews.text: I have a towel similar to this - the Absorber towel for drying my car but the problem is if gets dry it hardens making it difficult to get it wet enough to get malleable again. This towel is different. While it does harden when dried, it immediately becomes soft once you wet it and it's much more towel-like than my Absorber which I would consider more rubbery. It's great for wiping down counters or wiping up spills. very impressed with the material feel and quality.
customer_reviews.author: ibTom

customer_reviews.title: the jury is still kinda out on this product
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. I hate how regular dish towels smell funky after a while - and we have a big problem with this with our well water. I thought this might work better since they can be put in the dishwasher, etc to clean. They clean dishes well, are absorbent but I can't seem to get them clean after you use them on something like spag sauce. They seem to stain and that stain is set. I will continue using them before I make a final decision
customer_reviews.author: mollysmom

customer_reviews.title: Makes dishwashing a breeze!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! First used these while visiting my daughter. She uses them for washing dishes - and I loved them! They are just the right size for washing dishes, pots and pans, and ring out tight for wiping down countertops and stove and appliances with no streaking. Best part, you can wring them out with a one-hand-squeeze. When they get a bit grungy looking, they make great house cleaning cloths - sturdy yet pliable enough to get into small corners and spaces. Completely washable. ( Tip: Dry flat so they can stack and lay flat in the drawer with the others for neater storage.) Love them!
customer_reviews.author: busyliving

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever and it does not stink!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried some many table wipes for cleaning and wiping down table and counter tops. This is the best one by far. It is great pricing, easy to use, fast drying and the best thing is that it does not stink or smell. It will get dirty over time and eventually you will have to throw it away as it is biodegradable (so it will fall apart eventually). Still I am able to get a couple of months out of each wipe. I will be buying this and only this over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Love Them!
customer_reviews.text: Where have these been all my life? If you hate smelly, dirty dish rags, you’ll love these as much as I do. I let mine dry over the faucet. When dry, I put it on the corner or my sink or in a vertical napkin holder. I love the simple flower design and bright colors. They have not stained so far either. I just cleaned my stovetop. You know how your dish rag can get stained, stains that remain even after laundering? Well, the brown marks rinse away with these little gems.
customer_reviews.author: Katheryn

customer_reviews.title: Great paper towel alternative
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a paper towel alternative that I didn't have to clean in a washing machine (don't have one in my apartment, trying to cut down on paper usage during COVID-19 lockdown). These work great! Most important tip is to wet the cloths before drying things (sounds counter-intuitive but this is the way it works). They soak up water on kitchen counter, around the bathroom sink, and I'm using one with Lysol spray to disinfect items from the grocery store/deliveries. I even used one to soak up water from tofu that I was pressing before frying, and it worked like a dream. Easy to clean too - throw in your dishwasher, or hand wash with soap. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sara G.

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite sponge.
customer_reviews.text: These hold up incredibly well, and my favorite part: They don't smell funky like traditional sponges and cloth rags often do after so many uses. They hold moisture and soap well, so they're great for cleaning up messes on counters or for washing dishes. They also don't disintegrate like some sponges do after too many uses. There were four in the pack, and I'm still using the same cloth several months after buying the product early this summer. A little more upfront cost compared to a traditional sponge, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: M.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great eco-friendly paper towel/sponge replacement
customer_reviews.text: Love these Skoy eco-friendly dishcloth! They replace the use of paper towel and last a LONG time. Wet them, use them to wipe/clean, wash, and repeat. It’s that simple! I don’t feel guilty killing trees anymore like when I used paper towels. The Skoy cloth is a small footprint in the kitchen and drys fast. Best of all, it doesn’t smell and cleans easily! To use them to clean: 1. wet them and squeeze out excess water, 2. wipe/clean areas, 3. wash cloth and hang dry. The grease/stain rinses off without much effort. My favorite uses are with baking soda to wipe off the grease on countertops, appliances, and backsplashes.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie C.

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: I saw these in an online article and ordered right away - thinking I'd found a great compliment to my beloved Scrub Daddy. They are underwhelming. They stain easily and are only absorbent the first use. Mine also stained quickly and haven't washed up well. I ordered these - and the reason I use the Scrub Daddy - because I HATE sponge smell, it makes me gag pretty badly. These don't smell as bad as a sponge does, but they don't stay as nice as the Scrub Daddy products.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in March. I have only been using one. I don't use it a lot like I thought I would have. I like the idea of this but it's difficult to clean so that gets annoying, tried cleaning in the dishwasher but other particles got on it. The best way to clean is by using a hand spray. I don't like how they shrink. If you look at pics, the blue one is used and yellow is new.
customer_reviews.author: Mimish

customer_reviews.title: It's all true!
customer_reviews.text: If you're skeptical about Swedish dish towels as I was (I'm thinking, "is this another scam-wow?"), this set is priced well enough to try out. I gave two of these to my mother in law as a small gift, kept one and sent the other to my best friend. Everything is true! These guys really go pliant and soak up the water after wetting, and survive all sorts of hand wringing and trips through the washing machine. They dry fast, too, and then resemble a thin sheet of cardboard conforming to whatever surfaces you lay them on.
customer_reviews.author: MThings

customer_reviews.title: Say, what???
customer_reviews.text: After trying these myself, I've bought 3 more sets for friends and relatives! Something so simple is simply the best!!! I'm a dish cloth user from way back and I wasn't sure I'd like these, but I'm hooked!! I like that they are biodegradable and that you can put the in the microwave to disinfect. And they don't smell like a used dish cloth does! Don't let their seemingly flimsy appearance fool you.... these are a work horse!! You won't be disappointed if you decide to get these!! = )
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: The only kitchen rag I use
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE swedish dish cloths. I hate rags that get smelly. These never, ever do. They absorb a lot and dry quickly. If they are completely dry, you have to get it a little wet before you can absorb too much of anything. While they sting easily, they otherwise clean up well. I usually put it in the microwave for about 1 minute after cleaning my kitchen. Then, it's ready to go for the next time. I use it for everything! - wiping the counters, washing the dishes, soaking up messes. Carry versatile!
customer_reviews.author: momonthego

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting down use of paper towels
customer_reviews.text: I really like these little wipes. I like the fact that they enable me to cut down on my paper towel use. They come in real handy for small clean ups, & especially work well for wiping down the counters. I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 because it is hard, sometimes impossible to get stains out of them. I recommend using your least favorite color for clean ups that might leave a stain that won't come out.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy W.

customer_reviews.title: The Item Is a Low Quality Version of These Cloths
customer_reviews.text: I am used to using the similar product from Croatia and Bosnia. They are not sold in the US so I looked for something siimilar and I was happy to find the Swedish cloth that was supposed to be the same like what I'm used to. However, the thickness of this particular brand and product is 1/3 of what I am used to, and all other features (absorbency, softness, etc.) are below the expected level.
customer_reviews.author: Maida

customer_reviews.title: These are the best cleaning cloth around
customer_reviews.text: Skoy Cleaning Cloth -- They are bio-degradable, compostable, reusable, absorbent, dishwasher safe, clothes washer safe, do a great job of cleaning and no guilt when I have to throw them out. I have them in the bathroom, the kitchen and laundry room. I really like my Skoys. They do a great job of cleaning anything you can think of, that can be washed in water. They may look funny when they dry out, but, just re-wet them and they're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Que

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this cloths for a few years now, and love them! I use in the kitchen to clean up everything, you can even use it to wash dishes, because it’s basically a sponge type cloth. You will save so much on paper towels, and it won’t smell nasty like other cloths used in the kitchen if you put inside the dishwasher when you are running it with the dishes. Cleans well with or without spray cleaner, and it’s great to use in the bathroom too to keep the sink clean. I highly recommend this product because it lasts a long time and reduces the need to use paper towels all the time.
customer_reviews.author: N.T. Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm already in love with these dish cloths
customer_reviews.text: I'm already in love with these dish cloths. They clean well, they launder up well, and they dry quickly draped over my kitchen faucet. Paired with, these cloths work well for my dish washing needs. The Lunatec dishcloths provide the scrubbing power I need & the Skoy cleaning cloth hangs onto the soap suds longer, allowing me to not overuse dish soap.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissie McP

customer_reviews.title: Even better than IKEA
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in search of an alternative to the Swedish dishcloths I got at IKEA. I liked those for their strength, but they didn't seem to last as long. Let me tell you- these are 10x better. They're way more absorbant as a result of being thicker material. Also, these seem to hold far less odor than other dishcloths. I highly recommend trying them out. Once I use one of these up thoroughly, I'll update this review as to how these compost.
customer_reviews.author: Daiton

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to regular washcloths again!
customer_reviews.text: I am anti-sponge, but I love these cloths! They are durable and easy to clean. I throw them in the washer with the rest of my towels and hang straight (from a skirt hanger) to air-dry. They are good for getting off stuck-on items from dishes and pots. I haven't used them for household cleaning, but I plan to designate a couple of cloths to replace the antibacterial/disinfecting wipes I currently use to do daily maintenance cleaning. I'm not fond of the colors in the assorted color pack, but these could be handy in color-coding what you use them for. Next time I may purchase the white ones. I definitely recommend and will purchase it again!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Love these little gems!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these cloths. The uses for them are endless really. Mine usually start off in the kitchen but even after I retire that one for a fresh one, it gets put to use for many other things. It then gets pretty abused but it just keeps on going. We are remodeling our home and these have been used to wash walls, clean up drywall dust, wipe the sawdust off trim after sanding,wash doorways to prep for painting and more. I plan to purchase these for stocking stuffers and gifts for friends and family. These are hands down one of my favorite products I have purchased from Amazon. I need to add the the customer service is absolutely OUTSTANDING!!!!
customer_reviews.author: nature is cheaper than therapy

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I’ve made
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased that I bought these. Makes keeping kitchen counters, sinks so easy! Once one has been an bit ‘ too used’ for my satisfaction in the kitchen then great for the shower, tub, floor spot cleaning. So easy to put in dishwasher or laundry. I am very impressed that they don’t get shredded.... at least not one of mine has. They let o long I’ve yet to throw one out!
customer_reviews.author: foto-u

customer_reviews.title: Skoy’s the limit.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these several years ago, and just started using them. They are great? Use them mainly in the kitchen to wipe spills, clean counters, scrub countertops. They are soft and relatively thin and can be folded to use for scrubbing. They have replaced paper toweling for a number of cleanup chores, and save money. Where I used to reach for a piece of paper toweling, I now reach for a Skoy.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S. Trapp

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for Cotton Dish Cloths
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of these Swedish dish cloths until the other day. I've always used cheap cotton dish cloths and throw them in the washing machine to clean. The first time that I used the Skoy cloths, I decided that I will never go back to the cotton cloths. The Skoy cloths clean extremely well, dry fast and have no odor. I just ordered a pack for my daughter. I'm sold on them!
customer_reviews.author: Luv My Dogs

customer_reviews.title: The best of the lot
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST sponge cloths out there. I have tried numerous versions but these have the best durability, absorption and staying power. I have been using them for over a year or more. I only recently purchased a new one because the one I had been using forever accidentally went down the disposal !!! No harm to the drain but a new cloth was in order.
customer_reviews.author: TomD

customer_reviews.title: Better than a sponge by far
customer_reviews.text: These skoy cloths are replacing some I got from Grove Collaborative which I prefer for their durability and absorbency, but since I no longer have that membership, these will do ok for the price. Way better than the sponges I was using for decades! I may try some of the others featured just to compare.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this items! Save my paper tower
customer_reviews.text: I use the absorbent cloths for counter wipe downs and general clean up and the scrubby in place of a regular dish sponge. I love being able to wash everything (I just wash them with my kitchen towels). The dish scrubbers work great -- they are very scrubby, but don't scratch, and they are so much nicer than regular kitchen sponges (plus they are washable, last longer and work better). I've only had these about a month, but I do LOTS of dishes and have washed everything multiple times, and it all looks good as new. I anticipate them lasting a long time. So much less wasteful than traditional kitchen clean up supplies!
customer_reviews.author: Meiqiong Zhen

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the set.
customer_reviews.text: I love using swedish dish cloths. They are a great combination of a sponge and a dishcloth. They absorb a lot of water. I mostly use them for cleaning counters, but they work great on dishes too. I like the colors in this set, they camoflog stains better than ones with a white background. The flower pattern is very basic, but so worth the money verses the pretty patterned ones I was paying $5.95 each for at the store. They are easy to wash, just rinse them well or throw them in the washing machine and let them air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Island April

customer_reviews.title: Durable and dries fast, absorbs well. Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, love it, love it! After 3 weeks of use it is in good shape. Absorbs well, perfect thickness and it dries fast. Will probably not look for something else. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: moniq_n

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I haven't had to buy paper towels in months. A few things I really love about these (1) they do not start to smell after a few days like normal dish rags do, (2) are versatile -- can use to wash dishes, clean up messes, and even use to wash windows, (3) they do not stain, and (4) wash easily in dishwasher or washing machine. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sl2003

customer_reviews.title: Great cloth for cleaning
customer_reviews.text: these are super handy. Have one in both bathrooms, one in kitchen. Super for wiping up. They must be wet and squeezed out. Hold a ton of liquid. Ordered another for myself and daughter in law. Saves on paper towel, do not smell, can wash with soap. And it stays together. When I washed in washer I put in laundry bag. Probably wouldn't need to. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Brown

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this in a video where someone recommended this and I'm so happy I tried it!! I just purchased my second one, as I had given away a few of the cloths. These cloths are super absorbent and (for me) last a really long time. I use mine regularly in my kitchen and also hand wash it with dish soap. I've never tried to wash it in the dishwasher as it states. I may try that soon. As my first cloth (which lasted for almost a yr) is about done, I'm happy it is biodegradable.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlyne

customer_reviews.title: Good for washing dishes and wiping down the sink
customer_reviews.text: I got these after a house guest brought one to my house. I use it for washing dishes and wiping down the counters. Regular rags get stinky in Florida after a couple days. These don't get stinky and I rinse them lightly in bleach water once in a while and throw them in the washing machine if they get stained. They clean up well and wipe the sink down beautifully. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Straley, Author, Alzheimer's Trippin' with George

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, NO SMELL
customer_reviews.text: Love how this dries up so easily without any smell!!! I've always used rags, and were sick of the way they smell sour after a few washings. This product dries so easily without any smell, it cleans really well, and the rag itself is easy to clean! It looks cute too, way better than a dishcloth that gets old and ugly looking quick! This cloth retains it's color and look after several washings. I'm sure it will eventually need to be tossed, but I'm happy with how long it's lasted so far!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lissa

customer_reviews.title: The best of sponges, the best of paper towels
customer_reviews.text: I love these things! They're absorbent like a sponge but because they're so easy to wash and they're thin they don't get nasty like a sponge. It's like if a sponge and a paper towel got together and had a super-baby. I've been using the crap out of mine for about a month (so I can't speak much to longevity) have run them through the wash a few times and they're still in marvelous shape. They're adorable and over Thanksgiving when the family was over they were liking them too. I'm getting them as xmas presents for the paper-towel addicts in my life. Simply love that they're compostable, I'm not buying sponges ever again!
customer_reviews.author: Tanager

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. 3months and counting...
customer_reviews.text: Had to wait till one needed to be replaced. Hence this review is 3months later. Technically I didn't have to toss it. As it still was absorbing, dried quickly once squeezing excess liquid, and didn't smell. Amen! After a couple washes it did fade a little. A hole or two developed from scrubbing a countertop and washing knives. So the wear and tear made sense. Sill purchase more. I keep two in rotation for dishes vs. Random spills on the counters or floor etc. Pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Where have these been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had discovered these years ago! I have reduced the number of paper towels I use by 75%! They are super absorbent and I use them for all spills and messes (I have 2 young boys so there are a lot). They clean up very well afterwards. I squeeze them out and rinse with soap and water and stains are washed right out. I have thrown them in the wash and they come out like new. Just air dry and the next time you need to use it, get it wet again and squeeze out the excess. I keep one in every room.
customer_reviews.author: SPNewMom

customer_reviews.title: Too small and cumbersome.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with these. They are small, not much bigger than my hand. They work ok but the size and thickness makes them awkward to use and you almost need two at a time. Not sure they are saving the planet much as they would need to be washed regularly and take a long time to air dry. Honestly I’d just use a kitchen towel.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using a competitors product and these are far better. Bigger, more absorbent, more durable and they look a lot better overall. Really cost effective as well.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: best product!
customer_reviews.text: I love these cloths. I wish I found out about them sooner. I use them all the time and have cut back about 80% on use of paper towels. These are super absorbent and durable. I have several to use in different areas (ie: kitchen, bathroom, etc). They work great and are easy to clean. I have thrown them in the dishwasher to clean and also in the laundry. They last a long time. So happy to have found something to get rid of all the paper towels. I've given them out to friends and family too. Love these things!!!
customer_reviews.author: LQ

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I have a house with its own well which would cause our dishcloths to smell quickly. Even after washing them, I could only use the dishcloth two or three times before it would smell again. I only use them for wiping down my counters. I have tried various types and decided to try these. I absolutely love them! I have used one over and over and it never smelled gross. I put it in the dishwasher to clean it and it came out soft and smelling awesome. I would definitely buy these over any other dishcloth!!
customer_reviews.author: kly

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and durable
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can use these, let them dry, and use them again. One lasts me about 2 months, though I mostly just use them to wipe counters and the kitchen sinks. I don't use them to clean up my puppy's accidents, however. I just can't bring myself to wash that out and reuse. They can be thrown in the washer and reused. After you use the washing machine they do shrink a bit and never quite return to their original shape. At that point I relegate them to the bathroom to clean the sinks and tub. These are a great buy and I continue using them.
customer_reviews.author: Rivergoddess

customer_reviews.title: Yes, they are as good as most of the reviews!
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? I have to say that I was skeptical when I saw the hype on these. But I liked the flower motif and figured "Why not?" I do a LOT of dishes and cleaning, and one of these will last me for several months before it starts to get too worn to be seen in the kitchen. Those "graduate" to the bathroom, where they hide under the sink! They bleach up just a promised, and go through the washer and dryer like a champ. The only thing I've found is not to wash/dry them with microfiber cloths, as they stick to each other with amazing grip!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Feather Hollow

customer_reviews.title: Better than a sponge!
customer_reviews.text: I love these little clothes! They pick up crumbs easier than a sponge, rinse out easily and are great for spills and all kinds of little jobs I used to use a sponge for. The best part is that you can throw them in your dishwasher or washing machine and they come out perfect. I will definitely buy more if these ever wear out!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Rapkin

customer_reviews.title: No More Paper Towels!! You need these!
customer_reviews.text: I hate buying paper towels because they cost so much and you just throw them away. These Swedish rags are awesome because you can use them to clean anything and then set them aside and they dry like cardboard. DISINFECT THEM BY THROWING THEM IN MIC FOR 40 seconds. After a few days though, I throw them in the washer. They are completely reusable and hold up! Love them !
customer_reviews.author: Face215

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Besides using this to wipe up things like raw chicken juice or anything you'd want to wash after (to replace using a paper towel), this is literally thee most useless product in the world haha! ***Just use regular dishrags and they last a lifetime, not a few washes.** These didn't wash well at all and hardened after use, making them unbearable. They didn't scrub as well as sponges do either
customer_reviews.author: Anon.

customer_reviews.title: Durable, soft and absorbent
customer_reviews.text: I no longer use wash cloths in the kitchen. I now only use these cloths. They are very absorbent and they dry quickly. When dry they are rigid, when wet they are very soft. Spills are easily cleaned up. I've not had one fall apart. They can be thrown in the wash but I usually just hand wash them in the sink. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: KSH

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great replacement for a sponge or dishcloth. Great size for dishes and super absorbent for wiping down countertops. They last a very long time. I soak them in the sink in bleach water about once a week and they look brand new. Very tough and will last a long time. Highley recommend!
customer_reviews.author: lsusan tx

customer_reviews.title: Great paper towel replacement
customer_reviews.text: I think these have literally already paid for themselves with the amount of paper towel they’ve replaced. So much better for the environment too. I love how quickly they dry out after use so they don’t stay wet or get smelly. I hang them with clips from kitchen drawer handles so they dry out on all sides. They’re also easy to clean. I just put them in the washing machine when I do a load of dish towels with a little vinegar in the rinse cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Skoy Cleaning Cloths.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a packet of Skoy Cleaning Cloths and am very happy with them. I am saving paper towels as I use my cloth to clean up instead. The only thing I noticed is that the cloth is a bit small and could be a couple of inches larger. It is easy to sterilize in the microwave for one minute. Works well around my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: BARRY E. SCHELL

customer_reviews.title: Your everything cleaning cloth...
customer_reviews.text: Who needs paper towels when you have a Skoy? Cleans everything! Dries fast. Lasts longer than I expected. I've had a few last almost two years. When the one I use for dishes gets a bit shoddy, it graduates to cleaning the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: w00t

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: I used to waste a lot of bounty paper towels while in the kitchen and since Covid and the scarceness of paper towels, i decided to find something reusable that’s not a towel. I bought this as a trial and I’m so glad I did. They are soft, absorbent and very easy to clean. I’ve ordered the bigger pack as these are now my go to. Bang for my buck.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I’m a huge fan of these Swedish dishcloths and will never use regular ones again. They are really durable and can be washed again and again. My only knock would be that they aren’t quite as thick as another slightly more expensive brand I’ve purchased here in Amazon. PERFECT to use as a travel washcloth because they dry really quickly and don’t take up as much space and a normal washcloth. Give these a try and you’ll never go back to regular cloths again.
customer_reviews.author: PanicPrincess

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: I’m totally in love with these. Have cut down greatly on paper towel usage. They absorb just about anything and easy to wash. I’m obsessed. Will definitely be ordering more. I’ve only washed it once so far, if I notice a problem in the future I’ll definitely be updating my review.
customer_reviews.author: haseeb Ferozan

customer_reviews.title: Saves a ton of paper towels
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for awhile now and I really like them. They dry quick, are easy to wash, and save me from using a TON of paper towels. I keep 2 out (different colors) and use one to wash my kids’ hands and face after meals and one for cleaning surfaces. I throw them in the dishwasher every few days. The only thing I dislike is they’re an extra thing laying on my counter all day. I wish they had a loop or something so I could hang them on my backsplash.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing
customer_reviews.text: Officially an old person writing an awesome remove for dish clothes because I’m obsessed with these dumb things. Like for real. Throw away every dishcloth you own and by a single pack of these. If “life changing” too dramatic to say? Whatever...they’re life changing.
customer_reviews.author: The Bohs

customer_reviews.title: Great product - love love love.
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about these cleaning rags! Super absorbent and easy to wash. They look great and work fantastic! I feel the quality of this product will last for a long time. The colors are perfect and rich, and unlike sponges, they are sanitary. We use them everyday for everything, drop it the washer and wah-lah clean rag ready for use (we do not dry!). Another way to clean them is put the tag, small (pea size) soap and water in mocravavle bowl, heat for 1 minute and germs are gone.
customer_reviews.author: dagwood281

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive little  dish cloths.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these washcloths. They don't smell and get stinky, and they wash everything well and they don't seem to wear. I have yet to wash them in the wash machine with my other laundry yet, but I'm very very impressed with them. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: I prefer a regular sponge.
customer_reviews.text: These seem stiff to me and the stain did not wash out of them when I laundered. I prefer a regular sponge to these.
customer_reviews.author: agoldstein

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I’ll never buy sponges again! These are fantastic. Don’t toss in the dryer or they shrink. But I toss in the wash with my whites and some bleach when they start to smell and it takes care of any mildew stench that can develop as with any dish rag or sponge. I also use them at work (they love it too!) and I toss it in the microwave for a minute or two (soaking wet) to kill any stench. Super worth it and lasts.
customer_reviews.author: meg

customer_reviews.title: Love these for cleaning rubber seal on combo washer/dryer
customer_reviews.text: I have dogs, so there's always dog hair on clothes. I also have a front load combo washer/dryer. The hair spins out onto the rubber seal. These clothes are perfect for wiping down the seal and pulling off all the dog hairs. The hair picks and rinses off nicely after and they are washable and reusable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dry quickly
customer_reviews.text: These are great for dishes, very absorbent and dry quickly after use or when I've washed them. I put one in my disinfecting wipe container when wipes were used up. There is always some liquid left and these soak that up. Great for wiping counters.
customer_reviews.author: Bk70

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent
customer_reviews.text: I love these, they are really absorbent but squeeze out easily and dry quickly keeping it from getting smelly quickly. It dries hard but as soon as it gets wet, it's very soft. When it does begin to smell, I just throw them in the laundry basket to be washed on laundry day. Love it, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: I love these !
customer_reviews.text: I have stopped using regular sponges since I tried these a year ago. These are so much easier to keep sanitary, and I love that picking up crumbs is much easier, as well as getting into corners and other small spaces when washing dishes. They last for months, I clean them with soap and occasional bleach and the cloth comes out like new. they eventually get a little pill-y and thin, so change it out for a new one for looks rather than really needing a new one. I'm really happy with my purchases... I keep giving them away to show friends and family how great they are!
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied, but not 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty satisfied with a product, but it’s on a small and thin side. Could be a little thicker for better absorption. Other then that-good quality and easy to clean (can just stick it into dish washer)
customer_reviews.author: kit deng

customer_reviews.title: Reduce paper towel purchases
customer_reviews.text: Just received my 4th order of these. Gave some away to my book club friends. I hate using up rolls of paper towels and just throwing away. Skoy cloths are great for cleaning up spills or minor messes. Throw in dishwasher to freshen or even the washer. As they age, I relegate to cleaning in bathroom or other tasks before needing to dispose of permanently. I buy very few rolls of paper towels now..
customer_reviews.author: John's Sweetie

customer_reviews.title: Better than a sponge
customer_reviews.text: These are a great replacement for kitchen sponges. Soft and easy to use. For washing glassware they actually fit in the glass better than a square sponge. Nice large size for wiping down counters. They rinse well and dry fast if you hang over faucet. They don't smell moldy. I've washed them in washer several times. They are showing some wear, but still going. I'd guess one of these cloths will outlast at least a dozen square sponges.
customer_reviews.author: LAF

customer_reviews.title: great alternative to kitchen sponges
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these. Was tired of tossing moldy-smelling kitchen sponges - these work better and are much more eco-friendly. I don’t use them for washing dishes - I use them for wiping countertops and they are fabulous. Super absorbent. And when they get grubby, you just throw them in the washing machine, hang dry, and they are good to go again. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great towel for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these during COVID stay at home to replace using a ton of paper towels. These are great. I just wet and use with my normal cleaners to clean my kitchen. When they are dirty just throw in the washing machine with my towels and they are ready to reuse.
customer_reviews.author: Christy B.

customer_reviews.title: Great dishcloths for many purposes
customer_reviews.text: These Swedish dishcloths are great. They are super absorbent, sturdy, dry quickly, go right into the wash for cleaning and are easy to store. Use of paper towels has been reduced significantly as these towels are now my counter, sink and stove go-to clean up method. Oh - and the colors are pretty and seem to be colorfast.
customer_reviews.author: DavidNTLB

customer_reviews.title: Great sponge replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after trying out Ikea's line of cleaning cloths and having those fall apart after much use. These are a nice thickness to clean most dishes, though you do need another scrubber to get off the really baked on/cooked on foods. They wash well and do their job as they should!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as described!
customer_reviews.text: All I can share is that it is great! Have been using one of the Swedish Dishcloth for approximately 3-4 months still looks new. I will never buy paper hand towels again. Plus it has replaced my sponges too which saves me $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Adele

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in an effort to go green. I love the fact that you can wash it in the dishwasher, very convenient for my house. Only gave it 4 stars bc the stains don’t wash off easily. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought them for my very opinionated mom, ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my very opinionated mom, after almost 2 months of using them and her throwing them into the washing machine - she loves them. Just now she squinted at me and asked how much I paid for them. Looked it up and told her and she smiled and said Good Deal!. Should have also described her as frugal. VERY.
customer_reviews.author: JustineS

customer_reviews.title: i rarely write reviews but these are terrific. I was making a batch of simple syrup ...
customer_reviews.text: i rarely write reviews but these are terrific. I was making a batch of simple syrup (water with lots of sugar). One of my containers had a crack which I didn't notice until the counter was awash. I grabbed my usual tool, paper towel, and it picked up a little of the mess. Then I remembered I'd just gotten these. One swipe with a dry cloth and it got it all. I don't want to sound like a commercial but these work as advertised. A quick rinse of the cloth and I used it to clean my very sticky counter.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hindin

customer_reviews.title: A must have in your kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I think these are the bomb! They work great and are absorbent. Dry in no time at all! No more muaty smelling dish cloths. Price of this brand is less and they are top rate!! Try them you will be happy you did!
customer_reviews.author: Libby

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again. Better than dishcloths and paper towels.
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Better than any paper towel! They are absorbent and streak free on glass top stove. Can be washed and used over many times. Will use these instead of paper towels or dishcloths.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: so much better than regular sponge
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for a few years now and they last a LONG time. Put in the dishwasher (in the silverware section) and they clean just fine. Like so much better than regular sponges. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C.

customer_reviews.title: Much more versatile and easy to clean than paper towels, sponges, and dish cloths.
customer_reviews.text: These cloths are so much more compact than traditional sponges/dishcloths PLUS they never smell. I just throw them in with a load of towels to wash and let them air dry. Now I reach for them instead of paper towels to wipe up countertops. So much more versatile and easy to clean than paper towels, sponges, and dish cloths.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Better than sponges
customer_reviews.text: These work just as well as a sponge, and I prefer the texture of these. I used one for about 3 months before it got dirty enough that I decided to start using a second one. They also dry better and quicker than a sponge does, so it isn't as soggy as a sponge is.
customer_reviews.author: Newt Meador

customer_reviews.title: probably can find better
customer_reviews.text: really not all that the description says it is. have been using for a few months. they are good for mopping up spills but they do not wash clean, even in the washing machine. have been trying to find good substitutes for paper towels and these are not. i do use them still but don't think they are the best product out there.
customer_reviews.author: dgolden

customer_reviews.title: Sponges beware!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific product. I have black granite counter tops which show EVERYTHING in terms of residue from wiping, fingerprints, etc. It is nearly impossible to make them look clean without a lot of attention. The Skoy Cloth is the best at helping wipe down the counter tops, dishes etc. Oh.....they wring almost completely dry and don't reek of the foul kitchen odors related to sponges. I liked them so much I shipped some to my 2 sisters and my niece.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: We are repeat buyers of this product
customer_reviews.text: We purchased some of these cloths sometime ago, and given how well the lasted, and how pleased we were with them, we purchased them again. They do wear out eventually, but they are very durable and economical.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not a splurge a necessity
customer_reviews.text: Ok I thought this was a splurge and bought them because of some review. No longer a splurge but a necessity. Great for daily cleaning. I can’t tell you why I prefer them over washable towels but I do. Really do stand up to frequent washing. They also dry quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do with no lingering odor.
customer_reviews.text: Best dish cloth ever! Absorbs like a sponge and wipes up spills. Has no lingering odor like normal dish cloths have. When dry it is stiff but when wet it is soft and pliable. Have used them for year and they last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product cleans well, and dries fast. I used to use way too many paper towels, these have cut down on so much garbage!! I have put them through the dishwasher as well as the washing machine and they stand up to both. I have been sending them to friends to continue the waste reduction cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and last forever
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 4 or 5 packs of these over the last several years, and several of my family members now purchase these after using them at my house or after me giving them one to try. I love that they last forever (literally last a year+ usually) and I love that I can clean them by washing in the dishwasher or washing machine or microwaving them when wet. They don't retain a smell like most sponges and it's easier to clean them. I will keep buying more!
customer_reviews.author: MaineMama

customer_reviews.title: I think you won’t regret buying Skoy cloths.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Skoy cloths. Have purchased them before. They are used when wiping counter and tabletops in the kitchen. I launder them with dishcloths and dish towels in the washing machine. I never put them in the dryer but hang them to dry overnight. Hey folks, the Skoy cloths have paid for themselves over and over with so few paper towels purchased anymore. When the pandemic of 2020 struck, paper products are difficult for many to procure. Not me. I have my Skoy and use them instead of one-use paper products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Different thickness
customer_reviews.text: The cloths are rather thin and they have different thickness.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Save on Paper Towels!
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to reduce my usage of paper towels and saw these. I ordered a 4-pack. They are really wonderful to use and have really helped cut back on my use of paper towels. I'm ordering more!
customer_reviews.author: A_skywatcher

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye paper towels - great gift!
customer_reviews.text: They are very attractive and great for a stocking-stuffer, small gift, housewarming, etc. People love EcoFriendly stuff. We basically don't use paper towels anymore so the savings are HUGE. They last a ridiculously long time and wash well in the dishwasher or washing machine (dryer even!). Some last for 6 months or more. All around perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like a washcloth
customer_reviews.text: I use these to wipe my infants off after they eat. Soft and absorbent. I just toss them into the laundry to clean. They do shrivel up pretty fast, so I deducted 1 star for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I love these cloths, they work very well and are so much stronger than paper towels. I throw them in the washer and they come out great. Would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl C. Ciulei

customer_reviews.title: So handy to have in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: These are so useful in the kitchen. They absorb more water than a sponge or a paper towel, so I always have one around for cleaning up, especially after dogs and kids. I washed them in a load of towels in the washing machine (and left out to dry) and they cleaned right up. I expect they will last quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: thebarrister
